title: HUPO-PSI ID protein regions JSON format
description: A protein-centric entry for structural experiments.

proteinIdentifier.description: Unique Identifier (required): The primary identifier of the experimentally tested protein in a database describing the protein. The protein identifier should preferentially be a UniProt Accession from the UniProt database (e.g. uniprot:P47074) as most major IDP resource use UniProt accessions for protein mapping. The identifier should include an isoform and a version number if possible (e.g. uniprot:P47074-2.4).

proteinSequenceReference.description: Protein Sequence (optional): The full sequence of the reference protein sequence defined in 'Unique Identifier'.

proteinRegions.description: Protein Region (optional): A list of protein region objects defining structural experiments for a protein region

source.description: Source Database Entry Identifier (required): If the experiment is annotated in a database, the entry in that database should be referenced (e.g. disprot:DP00086r026 - P53 experiment example).

regionStart.description: Region Start (required): The start position of the experimental construct as mapped from the protein sequence defined in 'Unique Identifier'.

regionEnd.description: Region End (required): The end position of the experimental construct as mapped from the protein sequence defined in 'Unique Identifier'

regionSequenceExperimental.description: Region Sequence (optional): The full sequence of the experimentally tested construct including any tags, alterations or modifications.

regionStructureState.description: Region Structure State (optional): The structure state of the region as defined by the experimental data or as inferred by the experimentalist. Currently, limited to the binary classification of 'Ordered', 'intrinsically disordered' or 'Undefined'.

experimentReference.description: Unique Experiment Reference Identifier (required): An identifier for the experiment pointing to an article in PubMed (e.g. pubmed:12345678). Alternatively, may point to experiment information with DOI.

experimentMethod.description: Experimental Method (optional):A term for an experimental method as described in the Evidence & Conclusion Ontology ECO ontology [ECO](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/eco).

status.description: Source Database Entry Status (optional): The status of the entry as defined by Source Database Identifier.

lastModified.description: Source Database Entry Last Modified (optional): The date the entry in the Source Database Identifier was last modified.
